intro: Synostemon salignus, commonly known as the silky sycamore, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its smooth, light gray bark that peels in thin layers, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, typically blooming in the spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a soft, hairy texture. Synostemon salignus is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shady environments.
